metadata.title: CVE-2022-32089 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
MariaDB v10.5 to v10.7 was discovered to contain a segmentation fault via the component st_select_lex_unit::exclude_level.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32089` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.6.9-1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-client - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-client-10.6 - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-client-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-common - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-server - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-server-10.6 - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-server-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-test - 1:10.6.9-1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.6.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.6 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.9-1').
